string-array.name: os_question0
string-array.item: Which of the following is shared between all of the threads in a process? Assume a kernel-level thread.
Register values,$File descriptors,Scheduler priority,Local variables

string-array.name: os_question1
string-array.item: Which of the following is NOT used for synchronization?
Semaphore,Monitors,Busy waiting with test and set,$Reference bit

string-array.name: os_question2
string-array.item: Which of the following is NOT included in an inode in Linux?
File owner,$File name,File modification date,Pointer to the first data block

string-array.name: os_question3
string-array.item: A user-level process cannot modify its own page table entries.
$True,False

string-array.name: os_question4
string-array.item: A thread gets its own heap.
True,$False

string-array.name: os_question5
string-array.item: Where do you allocate a local variable in Linux?
Heap,$Stack,Data,Code

string-array.name: os_question6
string-array.item: According to Ken Thompson, which of the following 3 items define UNIX?
$Shell,$Kernel,File system,$Core set of applications

string-array.name: os_question7
string-array.item: When creating a process with fork(), which of the following 2 items are shared between the parent and child processes?
Data variables,$Heap,$Stack,PID

string-array.name: os_question8
string-array.item: What contains the metadata of a file in Linux?
$Inode

string-array.name: os_question9
string-array.item: A binary semaphore is also known as what?
$Mutex
